CatDescriptText: Ken Hawthorne, mechanic, Hill District and Lois Taylor, housewife, Hill District, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, August 6, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "In what areas of endeavor or public accommodations do you find the most discrimination?"  Mr. Hawthorne's answer reads: "Public schools and public places.  Recently some friends and I were refused service in one South Park area bar.  In a second bar, the owner would only serve us the beer in cans without glasses."  Mrs. Taylor's answer reads: "Housing in Squirrel Hill, and employment-for IBM machines."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Ken Hawthorne wearing uniform shirt with rolled up sleeves and Esso patch, standing in front of Esso gas pumps; Portrait of Lois Taylor wearing dress with embroidered floral overlay, standing in front of brick building
